channel.title: [PI] Running in Ubuntu
channel.description:
I for the love of me cannot get the server to run in Ubuntu. Other servers seem to work fine. Since, PI has a shit load of stuff in their run, its difficult for me to do this. Sh: [code=java]#!/bin/sh java -Xmx800m -cp bin;deps/poi.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar;deps/jython.jar;log4j-1.2.15.jar; server.Server[/code] After running it: [code=java]brandon@brandon-ET1331G:~/Desktop/SageScape2$ sh run.sh Usage: java [-options] class [args...] (to execute a class) or java [-options] -jar jarfile [args...] (to execute a jar file) where options include: -d32 use a 32-bit data model if available -d64 use a 64-bit data model if available -server to select the "server" VM -jamvm to select the "jamvm" VM -cacao to select the "cacao" VM -zero to select the "zero" VM -shark is a synonym for the "zero" VM [deprecated] The default VM is server.
-cp <class search path of directories and zip/jar files> -classpath <class search path of directories and zip/jar files> A : separated list of directories, JAR archives, and ZIP archives to search for class files. -D<name>=<value> set a system property -verbose[:class|gc|jni] enable verbose output -version print product version and exit -version:<value> require the specified version to run -showversion print product version and continue -jre-restrict-search | -jre-no-restrict-search include/exclude user private JREs in the version search -? -help print this help message -X print help on non-standard options -ea[:<packagename>...|:<classname>] -enableassertions[:<packagename>...|:<classname>] enable assertions with specified granularity -da[:<packagename>...|:<classname>] -disableassertions[:<packagename>...|:<classname>] disable assertions with specified granularity -esa | -enablesystemassertions enable system assertions -dsa | -disablesystemassertions disable system assertions -agentlib:<libname>[=<options>] load native agent library <libname>, e.g. -agentlib:hprof see also, -agentlib:jdwp=help and -agentlib:hprof=help -agentpath:<pathname>[=<options>] load native agent library by full pathname -javaagent:<jarpath>[=<options>] load Java programming language agent, see java.lang.instrument -splash:<imagepath> show splash screen with specified image See http://java.sun.com/javase/reference for more details. run.sh: 2: deps/poi.jar: Permission denied run.sh: 2: deps/mysql.jar: Permission denied run.sh: 2: deps/mina.jar: Permission denied run.sh: 2: deps/slf4j.jar: Permission denied run.sh: 2: deps/slf4j-nop.jar: Permission denied run.sh: 2: deps/jython.jar: Permission denied run.sh: 2: log4j-1.2.15.jar: not found : not foundserver.Server [/code] Any help, please?

item.title: [PI] Running in Ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @sageofmali sageofmali
item.description:
@sageofmali wrote:

xxxtilllyxxx:

It’s saying it cant find the server/Server class…

Lol, you have no idea… I know what it says and I already fixed it. I had to remove an extra “:” in the run, since someone said to convert it to colons.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Running in Ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @xxxtilllyxxx xxxtilllyxxx
item.description:
@xxxtilllyxxx wrote:

It’s saying it cant find the server/Server class…

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Running in Ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @sageofmali sageofmali
item.description:
@sageofmali wrote:

xxxtilllyxxx:

Also its not bash or anything use sh run.sh ftr, and rep is appreciated

Same error buddy, I’ve tried like everything. brandon@brandon-ET1331G:~/Desktop/SageScape2$ sh run.sh Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: server/Server Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: server.Server at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:217) at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method) at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:205) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:321) at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Launcher.java:294) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:266) . Program will exit.ain class: server.Server

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Running in Ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @xxxtilllyxxx xxxtilllyxxx
item.description:
@xxxtilllyxxx wrote:

Also its not bash or anything use sh run.sh ftr, and rep is appreciated

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Running in Ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @sageofmali sageofmali
item.description:
@sageofmali wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:6, topic:398624”]You’re all wrong.

In linux, they don’t use the ‘;’ to indicate a classpath component. They use ‘:’.[/quote]
Oh, okay thanks.[quote=“xxxtilllyxxx, post:7, topic:398624”]Just right click in the deps folder on all the .jar’s and go into the permissions tab and click the box that allows you to run it as a program,[/quote]
Damn, I forgot about that, thanks.

[quote=“I need a username, post:5, topic:398624”]now execute run.sh by running the command

sudo bash run.sh[/quote]

brandon@brandon-ET1331G:~$ cd "/home/brandon/Desktop/SageScape2" brandon@brandon-ET1331G:~/Desktop/SageScape2$ sudo bash run.sh [sudo] password for brandon: Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: server/Server Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: server.Server at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:217) at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method) at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:205) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:321) at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Launcher.java:294) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:266) . Program will exit.ain class: server.Server

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Running in Ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @xxxtilllyxxx xxxtilllyxxx
item.description:
@xxxtilllyxxx wrote:

Just right click in the deps folder on all the .jar’s and go into the permissions tab and click the box that allows you to run it as a program,

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Running in Ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

You’re all wrong.

In linux, they don’t use the ‘;’ to indicate a classpath component. They use ‘:’.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Running in Ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @I_need_a_username I need a username
item.description:
@I_need_a_username wrote:

now execute run.sh by running the command

sudo bash run.sh

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Running in Ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @sageofmali sageofmali
item.description:
@sageofmali wrote:

brandon@brandon-ET1331G:~/Desktop/SageScape2$ chown root run.sh chown: changing ownership of `run.sh': Operation not permitted brandon@brandon-ET1331G:~/Desktop/SageScape2$ ls -lah total 44K drwxr-xr-x 7 brandon brandon 4.0K 2011-06-06 13:10 . drwxr-xr-x 12 brandon brandon 4.0K 2011-06-09 13:03 .. drwxr-xr-x 3 brandon brandon 4.0K 2011-03-02 20:00 bin -rw-r--r-- 1 brandon brandon 710 2010-02-02 13:04 .classpath -rw-r--r-- 1 brandon brandon 673 2011-06-05 15:11 Compiler.bat drwxr-xr-x 8 brandon brandon 4.0K 2011-03-02 20:02 Data drwxr-xr-x 2 brandon brandon 4.0K 2011-03-02 20:00 deps drwxr-xr-x 2 brandon brandon 4.0K 2011-03-02 20:00 ECO -rw-r--r-- 1 brandon brandon 383 2010-02-02 13:04 .project -rwxrwxr-x 1 brandon brandon 158 2011-06-06 13:10 run.sh drwxr-xr-x 3 brandon brandon 4.0K 2011-03-02 20:00 src brandon@brandon-ET1331G:~/Desktop/SageScape2$ chmod 777 run.sh

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Running in Ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @I_need_a_username I need a username
item.description:
@I_need_a_username wrote:

Run it like this:

sudo bash PATHTORUN.SH

if that doesnt work use “chmod” command
=D

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Running in Ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @Ddragonimp Ddragonimp
item.description:
@Ddragonimp wrote:

Hmm seems like a permissions error im not suggesting you change the permissions to 777 but maybe 775 and change ownership think its ::chown

get to the directory where those files are located cd over to the deps/ directory and find ls -lah tell us the permissions.

Edit lol its not ::chown its just chown too much rs

chmod to change permission level
chown to change ownership

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Running in Ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @sageofmali sageofmali
item.description:
@sageofmali wrote:

I for the love of me cannot get the server to run in Ubuntu. Other servers seem to work fine. Since, PI has a shit load of stuff in their run, its difficult for me to do this. Sh: #!/bin/sh java -Xmx800m -cp bin;deps/poi.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar;deps/jython.jar;log4j-1.2.15.jar; server.Server
After running it: [code=java]brandon@brandon-ET1331G:~/Desktop/SageScape2$ sh run.sh
Usage: java [-options] class [args…]
(to execute a class)
or java [-options] -jar jarfile [args…]
(to execute a jar file)
where options include:
-d32 use a 32-bit data model if available
-d64 use a 64-bit data model if available
-server to select the “server” VM
-jamvm to select the “jamvm” VM
-cacao to select the “cacao” VM
-zero to select the “zero” VM
-shark is a synonym for the “zero” VM [deprecated]
The default VM is server.

-cp <class search path of directories and zip/jar files>
-classpath <class search path of directories and zip/jar files>
              A : separated list of directories, JAR archives,
              and ZIP archives to search for class files.
-D<name>=<value>
              set a system property
-verbose[:class|gc|jni]
              enable verbose output
-version      print product version and exit
-version:<value>
              require the specified version to run
-showversion  print product version and continue
-jre-restrict-search | -jre-no-restrict-search
              include/exclude user private JREs in the version search
-? -help      print this help message
-X            print help on non-standard options
-ea[:<packagename>...|:<classname>]
-enableassertions[:<packagename>...|:<classname>]
              enable assertions with specified granularity
-da[:<packagename>...|:<classname>]
-disableassertions[:<packagename>...|:<classname>]
              disable assertions with specified granularity
-esa | -enablesystemassertions
              enable system assertions
-dsa | -disablesystemassertions
              disable system assertions
-agentlib:<libname>[=<options>]
              load native agent library <libname>, e.g. -agentlib:hprof
              see also, -agentlib:jdwp=help and -agentlib:hprof=help
-agentpath:<pathname>[=<options>]
              load native agent library by full pathname
-javaagent:<jarpath>[=<options>]
              load Java programming language agent, see java.lang.instrument
-splash:<imagepath>
              show splash screen with specified image

See http://java.sun.com/javase/reference for more details.
run.sh: 2: deps/poi.jar: Permission denied
run.sh: 2: deps/mysql.jar: Permission denied
run.sh: 2: deps/mina.jar: Permission denied
run.sh: 2: deps/slf4j.jar: Permission denied
run.sh: 2: deps/slf4j-nop.jar: Permission denied
run.sh: 2: deps/jython.jar: Permission denied
run.sh: 2: log4j-1.2.15.jar: not found
: not foundserver.Server
[/code]
Any help, please?

Read full topic
